wpt.name: GC1MJ8X
wpt.desc: LGL #7 ½ - The Demon Slayers by GeoGirls of Chesco, Traditional Cache (2/2.5)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: LGL #7 ½ - The Demon Slayers
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:short_description: A small Lock-n-Lock hidden somewhere between LGL #7 and LGL #8. Not far off the trail and not way up in the rocks. There is no need to climb anything.
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
One winter day, three GeoGirls (SquirtGunn, deb3day and LNUGE ) were hiking along the old Low Grade line near the Trestle Bridge in Downingtown. After finding LGL #8 they were making their way west to find LGL #7. Suddenly, in the far distance they saw a group of guys in the middle of the trail – they weren’t moving towards the GeoGirls, they weren’t moving away from the GeoGirls, in fact, they didn’t seem to be moving at all!

The GeoGirls trudged on because, I mean, ya know – there was a Geocache just past that gang! As they got closer, the girls speculated on what this group of young men could be up to and the consensus was: NO GOOD! But the GeoGirls had two dogs with them and LNUGE was carrying her trusty “walking stick/monopod/geocache poking stick” (that had a pointy end that could serve as an effective weapon if needed) and of course ….. there was a Geocache just past those guys!

So the GeoGirls trudged on.

The closer they got, the more disturbing the scene became. One guy had a huge red splatter on his back, another was hooded in burlap and yet another was wrapped in bloody gauze! There were weapons in hands and red stains in the snow!

Eek, Yuk, Eww, what were the GeoGirls to do?

Forge on, of course…… There was still the matter of that Geocache – Ya know!

The geodogs lunged ahead … but they were not barking and snarling as faithful pooches should …. They were sniffing and licking! They were attracted to the corn syrup based “Bottle O’ Blood” !

The GeoGirls then noticed the tripod with the movie camera mounted on top! You could have heard the trio of exhales from Woodsy Owl’s perch! …… Just a few teens making a homemade movie! A great bunch of guys doing stuff other than getting into trouble. After a photo op with the guys it was no problem for the GeoGirls to hike on past to the owl's perch.

Soooo … on the way back to their cars, the GeoGirls placed a cache to commemorate their encounter with "The Demon Slayers!"
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:encoded_hints: Blood was shed to place this cache.

groundspeak:log.groundspeak:text: Looked for about 30 minutes, but no luck. I saw some likely places, but a few of them were not safe climbs -- maybe it was just the leaves, but with a 2.5 terrain rating, I figured that I must be looking in the wrong place. Well, maybe another time.
Strike 2 on this one. Had trouble getting a good GPS reading, but even with the hint, reading the logs and looking for about 30 minutes, no luck. Hopefully the third time will be the charm.
At long last, I get the smiley. After two previous DNFs, I emailed the CO for help. I'd been so close to it both times before! TFTC
